intro: Hemizonia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Hemizonia angustifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
